channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: HPE got tangled in MAGA conspiracy theories and now its $14 billion merger with Juniper could be thrown out

item.title: Four Key Facts About Trump’s New Tariffs, and a Town Hall Showdown
item.description: Plus, inside the weight-loss drug wars.

item.title: Singapore’s largest banks deliver a mixed report card on profits amid looming rate cuts and U.S. tariffs threats
item.description: DBS's quarterly profit grew by 1% yet the bank acknowledged "external uncertainties." Profit at fellow banks UOB and OCBC fell.

item.title: What CFOs say about AI when they’re speaking off the record
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Oakley’s billionaire founder is the latest victim of the sluggish luxury housing market—but the profit he could still make shows an underlying problem
item.description: Some ultra-wealthy luxury home sellers are being forced to drop the prices of their listings.

item.title: Trump’s Trade Representative: Why We Remade the Global Order
item.description: Tariffs were an urgent necessity. They’re already working.

item.title: How Ozempic Maker Novo Nordisk Lost Its Shine
item.description: The pioneering Danish drugmaker was once the most valuable company in Europe, but analysts say a number of missteps reversed its fortunes.
